Core:PCProperties.Core:Property:
(\{ (\{ "+\\
Act - freemoting\", "+The \act\ system uses the main Lotus [Lotus Settings\|settings object] for configuration. If you wish to enable freemoting using act on your game, set [theatre]:act:freemote-enabled to 1 in Data:lotus:Settings.", "+", "+Act in behavior is derived from the staff +emote command, where a plus sign followed by a word will lookup a person in the room for inclusion into the emit. An example:", "+", "+\> act smiles at +Harry and +Lucy with fanatical fervor, \\"We must destroy the infidels!\\"", "+", "+This would appear to myself and everybody except Harry and Lucy as:", "+", "+Kalle smiles at Harry and Lucy with fanatical fervor, \\"We must destroy the infidels!\\"", "+", "+To Harry as:", "+", "+Kalle smiles at you and Lucy with fanatical fervor, \\"We must destroy the infidels!\\"", "+", "+To Lucy as:", "+", "+Kalle smiles at Harry and you with fanatical fervor, \\"We must destroy the infidels!\\"", "+", "+Act is also available as colon, and will allow a user to e.g. do:", "+", "+\> :sings a song about songs sung.", "+", "+", "+\
\
\" \}), 1140642152, "zwoc" \})

(\{ (\{ "=1", "-The \act\ system uses the main Lotus [Lotus Settings\|settings object] for configuration. If you wish to enable freemoting using act on your game, set [theatre]:act:freemote-enabled to 1 in Data:lotus:Settings.", "+The \act\ system uses the main Lotus [Lotus Settings\|settings object] for configuration. If you wish to enable freemoting using act on your game, set (theatre):act:freemote-enabled to 1 in Data:lotus:Settings.", "=22", "-\
\
\", "+", "+", "+\" \}), 1140642358, "zwoc" \})

"\\
Act - freemoting\\The \act\ system uses the main Lotus [Lotus Settings\|settings object] for configuration. If you wish to enable freemoting using act on your game, set (theatre):act:freemote-enabled to 1 in Data:lotus:Settings.\\Act in behavior is derived from the staff +emote command, where a plus sign followed by a word will lookup a person in the room for inclusion into the emit. An example:\\\> act smiles at +Harry and +Lucy with fanatical fervor, \\"We must destroy the infidels!\\"\\This would appear to myself and everybody except Harry and Lucy as:\\Kalle smiles at Harry and Lucy with fanatical fervor, \\"We must destroy the infidels!\\"\\To Harry as:\\Kalle smiles at you and Lucy with fanatical fervor, \\"We must destroy the infidels!\\"\\To Lucy as:\\Kalle smiles at Harry and you with fanatical fervor, \\"We must destroy the infidels!\\"\\Act is also available as colon, and will allow a user to e.g. do:\\\> :sings a song about songs sung.\\\\\\"
